definition: (lit.) to have taken the wrong medicine/(fig.) (of one's behavior etc) different than usual/abnormal
to eat/to consume/to eat at (a cafeteria etc)/to eradicate/to destroy/to absorb/to suffer/to stammer (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [ji2])
mistake/wrong/bad/interlocking/complex/to grind/to polish/to alternate/to stagger/to miss/to let slip/to evade/to inlay with gold or silver
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
leaf of the iris/variant of 藥|药[yao4]

sentences.english: The inside didn't also see you etc. here in regular times, today really took a bad medicine.
sentences.chinese: 平日里也没见你在这等过，今天真是吃错药了。

sentences.english: You were on cold medicine last week or something?
sentences.chinese: 你上星期是吃错药还是怎么了？

definition: to short-circuit/(fig.) to have a mental lapse/to get one's wires crossed/to be addled
(lit.) to have swallowed gunpowder/(fig.) to be ablaze with anger/ornery/snappy
erhua variant of 缺心眼[que1 xin1 yan3]
(slang) (pun on 神經病|神经病[shen2 jing1 bing4]) crazy person/nutjob
lit. mention the pot that doesn't boil (idiom); to touch a sore spot/to talk about sb's weak point
pinyin: na3 hu2 bu4 kai1 ti2 na3 hu2

definition: to get sick because of bad food
